segments.text: Have you every belonged to a political party ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: No , I haven ’ t , but I thought about joining the green party .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Really ? I know you are very concerned about the environment . You were a member of the pressure group Greenpeace , weren ’ t you ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes . I was . But I didn ’ t have enough time to devote to it .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: The green party have no chance of winning an election . The other parties are too big and popular .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: You ’ re right . But smaller political and pressure groups can often influence large political parties . Any member of parliament can propose legislation and parties and pressure groups can raise awareness
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Most people are not very politically aware . They often don ’ t understand the issues fully .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That ’ s true . But it ’ s a little strange because the media often reports on political events . You can read about them in newspaper or hear them on tv .
segments.speaker: S2
